headline: 'You don't know squat': Ohio GOP Senate candidates Mike Gibbons, Josh Mandel have heated exchange during forum
sentences: Senator and Ohio voters got a first hand look at just how unprepared Josh Mandel has become and that will be reflected on the ballot on May 3,” Gibbons' spokesperson Samantha Cotten wrote in a statement.
A face-to-face clash between Gibbons and Mandel began after Gibbons accused the former Ohio Treasurer of "never having worked in the private sector."
Vance, Matt Dolan, Jane Timken, and Mike Gibbons answering questions on a range of topics including business deals and voter registration.
COLUMBUS, Ohio — Things got heated during a forum featuring the GOP candidates for the U.S. Senate in Ohio on Friday evening in Gahanna.

pic.twitter.com/fQuqfHxXHT
— Heartland Signal (@HeartlandSignal) March 18, 2022
Gibbons then told Mandel to "back off."
Gibbons responded, "You don't know squat," which prompted Mandel to move closer to the Cleveland-based businessman.
Mike Gibbons and Josh Mandel get in each other’s faces at tonight’s GOP #OHSen forum hosted by FreedomWorks.
The forum was hosted by FreedomWorks on Facebook Live and featured Republican candidates Josh Mandel, J.D.
"You back off," Mandel shouted back, adding to Gibbons that he's "dealing with the wrong guy."
Mandel got up from his seat and yelled, "Two tours in Iraq, don't tell me I haven't worked!"
He doesn't have the temperament, experience, or fortitude to be a U.S.
“Josh Mandel is unhinged, unfit and flailing - because he's losing.
Mandel's campaign has yet to release a statement on the incident.
The confrontation occurs around the 49 minute mark of the video.
He is only a professional at one thing: running for office.
The two had to be separated by the forum's moderator.
He is hellbent on lying because he is failing.
